Tadaa, Wilcoxon!

Tadaa, Wilcoxon!

tadaa_wilcoxon(data, response, group, direction = "two.sided",
  paired = FALSE, na.rm = TRUE, print = "df", ...)

Arguments

data

A data.frame.
response

The response variable (dependent).
group

The group variable, usually a factor.
direction

Test direction, like alternative in t.test.
paired

If TRUE, a paired t.test is performed with approproate power calculation.
na.rm

If TRUE (default), missing values are dropped.
print

Print method, per default a regular data.frame. Otherwise passed to sprinkle_print_method for fancyness.
...

Further arguments passed to wilcox.test, e.g. correct = FALSE.

Value

A data.frame by default, otherwise dust object, depending on print.

See also

Other Tadaa-functions: tadaa_aov, tadaa_kruskal, tadaa_nom, tadaa_normtest, tadaa_one_sample, tadaa_ord, tadaa_t.test

Examples

df <- data.frame(x = runif(100), y = sample(c("A", "B"), 100, TRUE))
tadaa_wilcoxon(df, x, y)
#>   statistic  median1   median2   p.value
#> 1      1184 0.474049 0.4661924 0.6540176
#>                                              method alternative
#> 1 Wilcoxon rank sum test with continuity correction   two.sided

df <- data.frame(x = runif(100), y = c(rep("A", 50), rep("B", 50)))
tadaa_wilcoxon(df, x, y, paired = TRUE)
#>   statistic   median1   median2   p.value
#> 1       763 0.6006741 0.5800668 0.2275632
#>                                                 method alternative
#> 1 Wilcoxon signed rank test with continuity correction   two.sided
